definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: He harrowed us with a tale of ghosts.
sentences.chinese: 他讲鬼故事使我们不安。

sentences.english: He loaded his friends up with ghost stories.
I get spookedfrom ghost stories and scary movies.
sentences.chinese: 我被鬼故事和恐怖电影吓着了。

sentences.english: The Duck remained abandoned and became the talk of local ghost stories.
sentences.chinese: “土鸭子”从此被遗弃了，成为当地鬼故事的一部分。

sentences.english: David is a timid boy. The ghost story makes his hair stand on end.
sentences.chinese: 大卫很胆小，一个鬼故事便把他吓得毛骨悚然。

sentences.english: He used to be terrified the children with ghost stories.
sentences.chinese: 他曾经是害怕鬼故事的孩子。

sentences.english: We can take this purpose of the ghost story further.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以进一步探讨一下鬼故事的作用。

sentences.english: It got a bit spooky when James started telling ghost stories.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯开始讲鬼故事的时候，有点让人汗毛直竖。

sentences.english: Billy: It's only a ghost story.
This places a moral importance on the ghost story.
sentences.chinese: 如此一来，鬼故事就有了道德层面的意义。

sentences.english: I say, "What kind of a ghost story?
sentences.chinese: 我问他们，“要讲什么样的鬼故事？”

sentences.english: What is the scariest ghost story you know?
sentences.chinese: 你知道的最吓人的鬼故事是哪个？

sentences.english: Today, the traditional ghost tale is said to be in decline.
sentences.chinese: 现在，传统的鬼故事在减少。

sentences.english: We can, if we choose, discount all of these ghost stories.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们愿意，可以对这些鬼故事漠然置之。

sentences.english: I'm a person who's always up for a good ghost story.
sentences.chinese: 我是个总会为精彩的鬼故事而着迷的人。

sentences.english: The ghost story frightened the pants off me。
sentences.chinese: 这个鬼故事把我吓得够呛。

definition: a form of automatic writing in which two or more participants hold a single pen over a sheet of paper and invite a spirit to write answers to their questions/a spirit so invited
form of divination similar to the Ouija board, in which participants use their forefingers to push a small saucer over a sheet of paper inscribed with numerous Chinese characters
to tell one lie after another (idiom)/to talk nonsense/bogus story
talking in one's sleep/words spoken during sleep/fig. speech bearing no relation to reality/delusions
sudden movement of a corpse (superstition)/fig. sudden torrent of abuse
